abstract.text: Create, save, and open documents in a multiplatform app.

metadata.title: Building a document-based app with SwiftUI

inlineContent.text: The Writing App sample builds a document-based app for iOS, iPadOS, and macOS.
In the app definition, it has a
protocol. People can create a writing app
document, modify the title and contents of the document, and read the story in
To build and run this sample on your device, select your
development team for the project’s target using these steps:
Open the sample with the latest version of Xcode.
For the project’s target, choose your team from the Team pop-up menu in the
Signing & Capabilities pane to let Xcode automatically manage your provisioning

content.text: Customize the iOS and iPadOS launch experience

inlineContent.text: You can update the default launch experience on iOS and iPadOS with a custom
title, action buttons, and screen background. To add an action button with a
to replace the default label. You can
customize the background in many ways such as adding a view or a
This sample customizes the background of the title view, using the
You can also add accessories to the scene using initializers such as
This sample contains two accessories in the overlay position that it
. It customizes the accessories by applying
To add both background and overlay accessories, use an initializer, such as
If you don’t provide any accessories, the system displays two faded sheets below
the title view by default. In macOS, this sample displays the default system
document browser on launch. You may wish to add an additional experience on

protocol to serialize documents to and from files. The
the sample can read and write, specifically, the
file. After reading the file’s data using the
input, it deserializes the data and stores it

function to serialize the data model into a

abstract.text: A scene that enables support for opening, creating, and saving documents.
Creates a document group for creating and editing file documents.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a set of actions, and a background.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a set of actions, a background, and a background accessory view.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a set of actions, and a background.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a set of actions, a background, and an overlay accessory view.
Creates a launch scene for document-based applications with a title, a background style, a set of actions, and background and overlay accessory views.
Enable people to open and manage documents.
A type that you use to serialize documents to and from file.
Serializes a document snapshot to a file wrapper.
Creates a document and initializes it with the contents of a file.
The file and data types that the document reads from.
The file wrapper containing the document content.
A button that creates and opens new documents.
A type that you use to serialize reference type documents to and from file.
Positions this view within an invisible frame with the specified size.
Offset this view by the specified horizontal and vertical distances.
A resource containing key-value pairs that identify and configure a bundle.
The uniform type identifiers owned and exported by the app.
Add unique elements to your app’s document launch scene.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Customizing a document-based app’s launch experience

abstract.text: Declare uniform type identifiers to support your app’s proprietary data formats.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Defining file and data types for your app

abstract.text: Make your document-based app stand out, and bring its unique identity into focus with the new document launch experience. Learn how to leverage the new API to customize the first screen people see when they launch your app. Utilize the new system-provided design, and amend it with custom actions, delightful decorative views, and impressive animations.

writing-app-ipad.png.alt: A screenshot displaying the document launch experience on iPad with a robot and plant accessory to the left and right of the title view, respectively.
